Package org.bonitasoft.engine.api

Interface PermissionAPI

  • public interface PermissionAPI
    Handle permissions of users
    Author:
    Baptiste Mesta

    • Method Detail

      • checkAPICallWithScript

        @Deprecated(forRemoval=true,
            since="7.14.0")
boolean checkAPICallWithScript​(String className,
                               APICallContext apiCallContext,
                               boolean reload)
                        throws ExecutionException,
                               NotFoundException
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        From version 7.14.0, use isAuthorized(APICallContext) instead
        Execute a groovy class, identified by it's class name, stored either in the classpath for default provided scripts, or in database for custom scripts. You can also add a jar containing a class implementing PermissionRule and execute it using its fully qualified class name.

        The class MUST implements PermissionRule. The class must implement method isAllowed() that returns TRUE to authorize access, or FALSE to forbid access. If the script throws exception, it is up to the calling application to decide if the access should be granted or not.

        To store your custom class in database, you must use the Setup Tool. Your custom groovy script must be placed in folder platform_conf/current/tenants/<tenant id>/tenant_security_scripts/. For more information on using the setup tool, refer to the Platform setup tool documentation page

        Parameters:
        className - the name of the class of the rule
        apiCallContext - the context of the api call
        reload - reload class when calling this method, warning if some class were called with reload set to false, they will never be reloadable
        Returns:
        true if the user is permitted to make the api call, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - If there is an exception while executing the script
        NotFoundException - if the script cannot be found under name className neither in the classpath, nor in the custom script folder.
        Since:
        6.4.0

      • isAuthorized

        boolean isAuthorized​(APICallContext apiCallContext)
              throws ExecutionException
        Checks if the REST API request defined in the APICallContext is authorized for the logged in user
        Parameters:
        apiCallContext - contains all the attributes of the request
        Returns:
        true or false depending if the user it authorized to make the call or not
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if there was an error while executing the authorization checks

      • getResourcePermissions

        Set<String> getResourcePermissions​(String resourceKey)
        Returns the REST permissions required to access a REST resource (the expected format for the resource key is |/ e.g. GET|identity/user)
        Parameters:
        resourceKey - the resource identifier. The expected format is |/ (e.g. GET|identity/user)
        Returns:
        a Set of permissions, as Strings. e.g. ["organization_visualization"]
